Iterates over all records in sort order. For use in foreach loop.

ForwardFromCurrent

Iterates over records in sort order, from the current position on. For use in foreach loops. If duplicates are allowed, then the next position may be on the same key, in duplicate sort order.

Declaration
public Cursor.ItemsIterator ForwardFromCurrent { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
Cursor.ItemsIterator

Iterates over records in sort order, from the next position on. For use in foreach loops. If duplicates are allowed, then the next position may be on the same key, in duplicate sort order.

Methods

CheckDisposed()

Returns Cursor handle. Throws if Cursor handle is already closed/disposed of.

Declaration
[CLSCompliant(false)]
protected IntPtr CheckDisposed()
Returns
Type Description
IntPtr

Close()

Same as Dispose(). Close a cursor handle. The cursor handle will be freed and must not be used again after this call. Its transaction must still be live if it is a write-transaction.

Declaration
public void Close()
Remarks

Cursors will be automatically closed when they are owned by a write transaction. However, in a read-only transaction, cursors must be closed explicitly.

Delete(CursorDeleteOption)

Delete current key/data pair. This function deletes the key/data pair to which the cursor refers.

Declaration
public void Delete(CursorDeleteOption option = CursorDeleteOption.None)
Parameters
Type Name Description
CursorDeleteOption option

Dispose()

Close a cursor handle. Sames as Close(). The cursor handle will be freed and must not be used again after this call. Its transaction must still be live if it is a write-transaction.

Declaration
public void Dispose()
Remarks

Cursors will be automatically closed when they are owned by a write transaction. However, in a read-only transaction, cursors must be closed explicitly.

Dispose(Boolean)

Implementation of Dispose() pattern. See Dispose().

Declaration
protected virtual void Dispose(bool disposing)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Boolean disposing

true if explicity disposing (finalizer not run), false if disposed from finalizer.

Get(out KeyDataPair, DbCursorOp)

Internal GET operation. Valid for MDB_GET_CURRENT, MDB_FIRST, MDB_NEXT, MDB_PREV and MDB_LAST. Returns both, key and data.

GetData(out ReadOnlySpan<Byte>, DbCursorOp)

Internal GET DATA operation. Valid for MDB_FIRST_DUP, MDB_NEXT_DUP, MDB_NEXT_NODUP, MDB_PREV_DUP, MDB_PREV_NODUP MDB_LAST_DUP, MDB_GET_MULTIPLE, MDB_NEXT_MULTIPLE and MDB_PREV_MULTIPLE. Returns data, but not key.

Put(KeyDataPair, CursorPutOption)

Store by cursor. This function stores key/data pairs into the database. The cursor is positioned at the new item, or on failure usually near it. Note: Earlier documentation incorrectly said errors would leave the state of the cursor unchanged.

Declaration
public bool Put(in KeyDataPair entry, CursorPutOption option)
Parameters
Type Name Description
KeyDataPair entry
CursorPutOption option
Returns
Type Description
Boolean

true if inserted or updated without error, false if NoOverwrite was specified and the key already exists.

PutInternal(KeyDataPair, UInt32)

Renew(ReadOnlyTransaction)

Renews cursor, allows re-use without re-allocation. Only valid for read-only cursors.
